metadata.synopsis: General dialogue for the merchant after the Rivington Rats leave and/or if the player makes a choice in the WYR_MerchantsHouse_Merchant_Conflict dialogue that ends it.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Talk to the merchant outside his house after the main conflict dialogue.

0.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
0.text: Who are you? And what do you want?
0.context: NodeContext: Confused at the player popping up now; a little worried by it

2.speaker: Player
2.text: I changed my mind - I think the family should stay here after all.

34.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
34.text: But you said you'd get rid of them! And I believed you - more fool me.

107.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
107.text: But you said you'd get rid of them! And I believed you - more fool me.

185.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
185.text: Well... with Zenovia and the others gone, I don't suppose you'll take no for an answer.
185.context: NodeContext: Resigned/weary; sees no other option

186.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
186.text: All right - they can stay. Are you happy now?

104.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
104.text: Now I have to figure out what I'm going to do...
104.context: NodeContext: Annoyed as the refugees are still taking up his house

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I'm sure a man of your means can find room at an inn somewhere.
62.context: NodeContext: Blindsided by the player knowing his secret; growing concern

93.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
93.text: A room can wait. After what you've put me through, I need a drink.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: You're going to jail - I found the explosive toy bears you 'donated'.
39.context: NodeContext: Blindsided by the player knowing his secret; growing concern

133.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
133.context: NodeContext: Blindsided by the player knowing his secret; growing concern

19.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
19.text: Whatever you think you know, I'm sure some gold would help you to forget.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: I'm here to see you are brought to justice.
109.context: NodeContext: Keen to protest his (false) innocence

95.speaker: Player
95.text: Keep your gold - I want answers.
95.context: NodeContext: Keen to protest his (false) innocence

117.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
117.text: I'm just a simple toymaker - an artisan! I don't know anything!
117.context: NodeContext: Keen to protest his (false) innocence

131.speaker: Player
131.text: If I were after gold, I would have gutted you and taken it.
131.context: NodeContext: Panicked/scared of the player and their threats; keen to protest his (false) innocence

55.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
55.text: Please don't! What do you want from me? It's not my fault - I was forced to do this. Framed, even!
55.context: NodeContext: Panicked/scared of the player and their threats; keen to protest his (false) innocence

124.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
124.text: They would've killed me if I refused to rig the toys - and they're definitely going to kill me now!

130.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
130.text: I can't tell you. I won't tell you.

23.speaker: Player
23.text: Tell me who 'they' are or you'll be dead before they even get to you.
23.context: NodeContext: Scared of the player and trying to placate them

173.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
173.text: All right, all right - just don't hurt me!
173.context: NodeContext: Scared of the player and trying to placate them

88.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
88.text: All right, all right - just don't hurt me!
88.context: NodeContext: Scared of the player and trying to placate them

52.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
52.text: The teddy bears were an experiment - my greatest invention. A clever little device in their chest allows them to speak.
52.context: NodeContext: Anxious but also frustrated; he's definitely quite proud of his explosive teddy bears

58.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
58.text: But there's more. Smokepowder, inside the device. I collect packages from Felogyr's Fireworks in the Lower City, and stuff the bears with it.
58.context: NodeContext: Fearful - clearly doesn't like recounting this

98.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
98.text: Not because I want to - because I have to. Otherwise they'll kill me.
98.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact (but a little too excited about seeing them in action before catching himself)

142.speaker: Player
142.text: I've been to Felogyr's. So you're in cahoots with Gortash.

141.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
141.text: Would you keep it down? Or do you want to get us both killed?

127.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
127.text: I'm no more 'in cahoots' with Gortash than you are. Which is to say I'm just as much under his thumb as anyone else in this city.

83.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
83.text: If you've been there, you know more than I do. Now will you please let me go?

35.speaker: Player
35.text: You still haven't told me who 'they' are.

73.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
73.text: I don't know who's in charge - but it starts at the fireworks shop. That's where the packages come from.

79.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
79.text: Go there - tell them Uncle Felogyr sent you, and they'll show you the smokepowder. Lots of it.

161.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
161.text: There, I told you what you wanted to know. Now will you let me go?
161.context: NodeContext: Anxious again; really wants to get out of here

169.speaker: Narrator
169.text: *His plea comes with an offering - a pass, granting you access to the Lower City.*
169.context: CinematicNodeContext: Arfur hands player something off-screen

17.speaker: Player
17.context: NodeContext: So ridiculously grateful at having been allowed to live

94.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
94.text: Oh, I will! Thank you! Thank you so much!
94.context: NodeContext: So ridiculously grateful at having been allowed to live

92.speaker: Player
92.text: Thanks, but I'll need all your gold too.
92.context: NodeContext: Scared/anxious to offload his gold in exchange for freedom/life

32.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
32.text: Here, take it - all of it, I don't care! You'll never see me again, I promise!
32.context: NodeContext: Scared/anxious to offload his gold in exchange for freedom/life

46.speaker: Player
46.text: What's this, bribery? The only place you're going is prison.

61.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
61.text: You can't be serious - they'll find me. A cell won't keep me safe! They run this city.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: I could just kill you, but I'm giving you a chance. I suggest you take it.
49.context: NodeContext: Convinced he's going to meet a grizzly end

118.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
118.text: All right, all right, I'll go! But if I'm found hanging in my cell, it'll be on your conscience.
118.context: NodeContext: Convinced he's going to meet a grizzly end

7.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
7.text: All right, all right, I'll go! But if I'm found hanging in my cell, it'll be on your conscience.
7.context: NodeContext: Convinced he's going to meet a grizzly end

180.text: No! I'll be trapped like a rat.

149.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
149.text: No! I'll be trapped like a rat.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: At least in a prison there'll be walls to break through before anyone can get to you.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Gortash doesn't run the city anymore. I dealt with him - he's no threat to you.

42.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
42.text: It doesn't stop with Gortash - his people are everywhere, choking the life out of the city. If I stay here, they'll kill me.

81.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
81.text: It doesn't stop with Gortash - his people are everywhere, choking the life out of the city. If I stay here, they'll kill me.

172.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
172.text: I've told you everything - and, in the end, no one was hurt. Please, just let me go!

145.speaker: Player
145.text: Sorry, but you had your chance. Now you die.

105.text: It won't end with him - his people are everywhere. But I'll go quietly. Maybe I have a chance.
105.context: NodeContext: Resigned (but still a little scared)

132.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
132.text: It won't end with him - his people are everywhere. But I'll go quietly. Maybe I have a chance.
132.context: NodeContext: Resigned (but still a little scared)

28.speaker: Player
28.text: All right, just run and never come back.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: Appreciate it. But now I know all that, I don't think I can let you go - sorry.
171.context: NodeContext: Panicked; he's about to be attacked by the player

106.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
106.context: NodeContext: Panicked; he's about to be attacked by the player

60.speaker: Player
60.text: So you'd rather kill children than risk your own skin?

114.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
114.text: It sounds terrible when you put it like that. But maybe you can put a stop to this whole operation.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: I'm strongly considering killing you myself.

43.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
43.text: Please don't - I'm not the villain here! You could put a stop to the whole operation.

120.text: You don't know what they're capable of. I'd rather die by your hand than let them get hold of me.
120.context: NodeContext: Scared; mouth running away with him

67.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
67.text: You don't know what they're capable of. I'd rather die by your hand than let them get hold of me.
67.context: NodeContext: Scared; mouth running away with him

146.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
146.text: Uh... not that I want to die by your hand, of course. I'll leave - risk the roads - say goodbye to the city forever.
146.context: NodeContext: Suddenly realising what he's said; backpedalling and trying to convince the player not to harm him

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Then I have no use for you. Die.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Sounds like you're in over your head. All right - get going.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Fine - just give me the gold and I'll let you go.

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Give me the gold and we'll call it quits.

168.text: This is my house, not a home for waifs and strays!

3.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
3.text: This is my house, not a home for waifs and strays!

147.speaker: Player
147.text: I want the family to stay. You have room for them, surely?

18.speaker: Player
18.text: I gave you a chance to let them stay. Since you didn't, I'll make you.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I'll deal with your squatters - just make sure you have your purse ready.

44.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
44.text: Purse? You said you'd get rid of them free of charge!

14.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
14.text: Ugh... but if that's what it takes to get them out of my house, fine. Get on with it.
14.context: NodeContext: Bitter resignation (emphasis on "fine" because it's really not to him)

122.speaker: Player
122.text: Sorry for the interruption. I have a tendency to pounce on people I don't like.
122.context: NodeContext: Scared (worried the player might turn on him as they just killed the thugs he hired)

112.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
112.text: If the Guild come asking, I'll be making it very clear that you took it upon yourself to kill their thugs. I had nothing to do with it.
112.context: NodeContext: Scared (worried the player might turn on him as they just killed the thugs he hired)

135.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
135.text: All's well that ends well, eh? I'm sure the Guild will be in touch with any concerns.
135.context: NodeContext: Scared (worried the player might turn on him as they just killed the thugs he hired)

75.speaker: Player
75.text: The squatters are gone - the house is all yours.
75.context: NodeContext: Jubilant that he has his house back

159.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
159.context: NodeContext: Jubilant that he has his house back

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I found some rather sinister things in your basement.
16.context: NodeContext: Exasperated (and emphasis on "really"; rhetorical expression of annoyance as opposed to a question/assertion)

91.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
91.text: Sinister? Nonsense. Those are experimental toys - guaranteed to bring a smile to the face of even the unhappiest child.
91.context: NodeContext: Exasperated (and emphasis on "really"; rhetorical expression of annoyance as opposed to a question/assertion)

5.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
5.text: They're extremely precious, and you shouldn't be poking around in my workshop and tampering with them!
5.context: NodeContext: Exasperated (and emphasis on "really"; rhetorical expression of annoyance as opposed to a question/assertion)

137.speaker: Player
137.text: I'll get to the bottom of this one way or another.
137.context: NodeContext: Exasperated (and emphasis on "really"; rhetorical expression of annoyance as opposed to a question/assertion)

74.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
74.text: Really - there's no 'this' and nothing to get to the bottom of!
74.context: NodeContext: Exasperated (and emphasis on "really"; rhetorical expression of annoyance as opposed to a question/assertion)

30.speaker: Player
30.text: Whatever you're up to, it's definitely not good. I'm taking you down.
30.context: NodeContext: Trying to calm himself in his internal monologue

113.speaker: Player
113.text: Yes you locked the basement, but it didn't help. Whatever you're up to, it ends now. I'm taking you down.
113.context: NodeContext: Trying to calm himself in his internal monologue

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Probe his mind for the truth.
56.context: NodeContext: Trying to calm himself in his internal monologue

175.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
175.text: Keep it together, Arfur. There's no evidence that links this back to you, and you definitely locked the basement before you left.
175.context: NodeContext: Trying to calm himself in his internal monologue

47.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
47.text: Keep it together, Arfur. There's no evidence that links this back to you, and you definitely locked the basement before you left.
47.context: NodeContext: Trying to calm himself in his internal monologue

123.text: Trying to use magic on me, are you? This conversation is over if you can't take a professional craftsman at his word.

162.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
162.text: Trying to use magic on me, are you? This conversation is over if you can't take a professional craftsman at his word.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: I found the explosive toy bears you 'donated' to the refugees.

10.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
10.text: Not now - I'm trying to think.

29.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
29.text: Look, I really don't have time to chat - I'm sure you can find someone less busy to listen to you somewhere.
29.context: NodeContext: Dismissive/distracted; has things to be getting on with

72.speaker: Player
72.text: I've found the toys you donated - care to explain before everything blows up in your face?

77.speaker: Player
77.text: So what are your plans now?

108.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
108.text: Thank you so much for your interest but it's really none of your concern, is it, hm? Excuse me.

33.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
33.text: All right - you won, you won! What more do you want from me?
33.context: NodeContext: Panicked; worried the player is going to attack him

45.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
45.text: All's well that ends well, eh? I'm sure the Guild will be in touch with any concerns.
45.context: NodeContext: Scared (worried the player might turn on him as they just killed the thugs he hired)

53.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
53.text: Nine Hells - you followed me all the way here? What could you possibly want with me now?

64.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
64.text: The Rivington Rats don't waste any time, do they? I can see why they were so highly recommended...
64.context: NodeContext: Morbidly in awe at the Rivington Rat's brutal efficiency

85.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
85.text: Anyway, I have a lot to do now those squatters are out of my hair. Goodbye.
85.context: NodeContext: Distracted; the player is getting in his way now

76.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
76.text: Bloody Zenovia and her bloody Rats - truly no honour among their kind. And you - what do you want?

80.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
80.text: A shame they had to die - but they brought it on themselves. And I'm the one who has to clean up the mess.

96.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
96.text: I haven't got anything else to say to you. Leave me alone - do you think you can manage that?

115.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
115.text: Don't deny it - I know it was you! You stole my gold! Unless it was one of those filthy squatting vermin...

38.speaker: Player
38.text: Well, if you talk to me like that, I'm definitely not going to help you.
38.context: NodeContext: Trying to catch himself/be civil despite his annoyance

170.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
170.text: Look, I'm sorry, all right? I just really need them out of my house as soon as possible. Please.
170.context: NodeContext: Trying to catch himself/be civil despite his annoyance

24.speaker: Player
24.text: You ought to watch those chancers you hired - I saw one of them a little too close to your pocket just now.

101.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
101.text: It was the little one, wasn't it? Tch, knew I couldn't trust him.

177.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
177.text: It was the little one, wasn't it? Tch, knew I couldn't trust him.

63.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
63.text: And what is it that you want?

11.text: You're only compounding your guilt! I have friends in high places - you'll pay dearly for this.

184.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
184.text: You're only compounding your guilt! I have friends in high places - you'll pay dearly for this.

138.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
138.text: Finally, those awful squatters are gone! I can feel everything unclenching already.
138.context: NodeContext: Relieved that the squatters have been ejected from his house

26.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
26.text: I must admit I'm not quite sure why you decided to change your mind, but all's well that ends well!
26.context: NodeContext: Confused but pleased by this turn of events

84.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
84.text: Here's your payment as we agreed.

102.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
102.text: I've got so much to do now - I'd really better get on with it. Excuse me, would you?
102.context: NodeContext: Distracted; the player is getting in his way now

144.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
144.text: You again. Did you need something?
144.context: NodeContext: Mildly annoyed by the player's presence but willing to humour them

152.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
152.text: Haven't you got anything better to do with your time than harass innocent craftspeople?

156.speaker: Player
156.text: How about putting you in the ground?

176.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
176.text: If the Guild come asking, I'll be making it very clear that you took it upon yourself to kill their thugs. I had nothing to do with it.
176.context: NodeContext: Scared (worried the player might turn on him as they just killed the thugs he hired)

1.speaker: Arfur Gregorio
1.text: So you should probably get away from the scene of the crime.
